Description: Shoulder sherd of North Ionian, possibly black-figured, pottery amphora; exterior: glaze band (fired red) band above four preserved rows of scales with added white dots in centre of each scale.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The sample number is written in ink 'NAU 16' on break (Dupont and Thomas 2006, 79). Geochemical characteristics of the fabric suggest the fabric did not originate at Clazomenae. Dupont, in a previous personal communication (dated 30-31 May 1978) had also suggested Samos as a possible source for the fabric. For parallels, see British Museum 1886,0401.1267.e.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 254)
Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78, 82-3, fig. 1) (NAU 16)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 137, no. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.044) (Phase 1)
